intro: Isophysis tasmanica, commonly known as the Tasmanian isophysis, is a flowering plant native to Tasmania. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
